titleproper.value: Guide to the Don Chenoweth Papers <num>TAM.216</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2020-01-03T20:15:47</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

extent.value: in 8 record cartons and 4 manuscript boxes.

abstract.value: Donald J. Chenoweth was a socialist activist. This collection contains material from multiple socialist organizations he was involved with from the 1930s through the 1950s, including the Independent Socialist League, the Socialist Workers Party, the Workers Party, and the Young People's Socialist League.

p.value: Materials were donated by Leslie Chenoweth in 1999. The accession number associated with this gift is 1950.169.
Donald J. Chenoweth was a socialist activist and member of the Independent Socialist League, and of other progressive collections.

The collection contains material including minutes, internal memos, circulars, publications, and correspondence of American socialist groups including the Independent Socialist League, the Socialist Workers Party, the Workers Party, and the Young People's Socialist League. Also part of the collection are articles, magazines, and other publications on topics related to socialism and, especially, Trotskyism, mostly from the 1930s- early 1950s.
